name: Squats
how_to_perform:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, facing forward or slightly inward.
2. Engage your core by pulling your belly button towards your spine, ensuring that your lower back remains neutral and your body forms a straight line from head to heels.
3. Slowly bend your knees, lower your body downwards while keeping the weight in your heels. Reach forwards with your hands to maintain balance if needed.
4. Continue lowering down until your thighs are parallel or below the level of your calves.
5. Pause briefly at the bottom of the movement, ensuring that your spine remains neutral and your body still forms a straight line from head to heels.
6. Push through your heels to return to the standing position, extending your knees fully but keeping your weight in your heels until you're back on both feet.
7. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, aiming to maintain control throughout the exercise.
short_summary: Squats are a compound lower body exercise that works multiple muscles, including the quadriceps, hamstrings, glutes, and core.
